Articles.Content:
Post your project tracking code here. You can find it in your persistent.sfs file in your save. Have fun!

Just a little FYI....

Horizon Star: Satellite

Achilles (May not be mentioned): 2nd Satellite

Project Little Jeb: Was supposed to be a manned SRB training test in preperation for the manned flight, but an miscalculation in the trajectory ended with Jebediah Kerman (accidently) becoming the first Kerbal in space. Ironically, the first manned flight into space was supposed to be crewed by.....Jebediah Kerman.

I'm rebooting my space program and while I know I could hop to the moon first flight, I'm doing it slow and methodical. So far I've:

1) put a basic satellite into Kerbin orbit

2) Put up three geostationary communication satellites, Scott Manley style

3) Unmanned 1-man capsule re-entry test

4) Unmanned 1-man capsule launch abort test

5) Unmanned 1-man capsule orbit and de-orbit test

I'm about to launch my first Kerbal into space in this reboot!

Meh, my progress isn't really valid because I'm using a save made in .19. I have left flags where I have been, but the tracking system doesn't seem to notice... I guess it's a good thing that this system is useless at the moment.

Edited July 26, 2013 by RocketPilot573
I'm debating whether I want to start a new world. I was able to revive my old one, but I kind of want a fresh start.

Sadly not much progress for me as yet.

However it will be interesting when the modders get around to using this info. For a start you could have the info shown in the game, which is the obvious one. Another more fancy thing you could do is have a mod to integrate into the ribbons generator. Assuming game engine security allows an outbound socket.

I haven't done much yet in my main save. I've mostly been fixing up my mods. So far I've been to, landed, and returned from Minmus with a probe, just to make sure the design works before sending my most prized kerbal, Kirk Kerman. I've also created a VTOL.

Sadly not much progress for me as yet.

However it will be interesting when the modders get around to using this info. For a start you could have the info shown in the game, which is the obvious one. Another more fancy thing you could do is have a mod to integrate into the ribbons generator. Assuming game engine security allows an outbound socket.

There seems to be a window on the debug menu for Progress, but nothing in it AFAIK...?
